title: Browser search box not adding Ebay
content:
Is there a way to add ebay in the search box? Normally you go to a site that is searchable (like Amazon or Twitter) and there is a green + symbol that appears in the top right browser search box in Firefox and you click on that to add it to the search box drop down list. But for whatever reason eBay does not have a green + symbol appear when you go to it. Can it be added or has it been restricted by Ebay rather than Firefox? I'm pretty sure it used to be there.

Windows 10 desktop Firefox version 89
creator: dog3456

title: How do I stop Firefox asking me every time it opens whether I want it to be my default browser.  Of course I do!
content: How do I stop Firefox asking me every time it opens whether I want it to be my default browser. Of course I do!

title: How  do I set a different home page and home button.
content:
I want the home page to be blank when I open the browser, I want the home button to a URL. This was possible in older versions, and when you then updated the browser it maintained this difference - if it was already set. I did that once but I don't remember how far back on versions that is an option. Is it possible to do this in 89? If not, how far back should I go to install, make my home page and home button settings, then update to the current version. Then we're all good.

If you could supply a link to the correct FF file (windows 10, 64bit) that would be even more good.

thanks
creator: callingdoug

creator: demeter1948

title: Facebook, Google probably cache problem
content:
Hello everyone! I`m using Firefox for a long time, but the following problem makes is almost impossible to us it anymore:

since a couple of month Facebook stopped working correctly on Firefox, it works for a while, then suddenly everything stopped, does not load anything, nor the page, nor messages... I need to clear the cache of facebook cookies then works for a while again... and then repeat.

It wasn`t a blocker problem with Facebook, but now it does the same with everything related to Google too. I push google button on bookmark, nothing, i push any button on Google (if already opened), nothing... Google docs buttons disappear, google login not works, etc... The same cookie cleaning helps, but i can not do this with google too... I`m logged in to work documents and stuff, can`t just reload everything every 10 minutes....

I use only Addblock Ultimate and Mouse Gestures Event, but tried disabling them without effect on my problem.

Thank you for your input!
creator: robert.bodnar

title: skype download page

content: Syncing Open Tabs to Mobile was unable to see my coordinated up tabs from my PC on both my flexible devices(Phone and Tablet)? The tablet shows all of the changed tabs from the phone anyway thework station shows the message "no open tabs" which I do. Exactly when I go to the changed tabs for the tablet, I see the phone and the PC recorded. The phone shows all of the coordinated up tabs from the tablet yet the PC shows the message "no open tabs" which isn't the case in reality. Curiously, both the tablet and the phone synchronized tabs all show up on the work station as they should. Envision a situation where anything am I missing. Similarly, every one of the three contraptions are all Samsung. Any help will with being esteemed

title: Firefox prompts user with "What should firefox do with this file?" window for iframe tags in HTML
content: I am trying to include some PDFs in iframe tags on my website. Previously they appeared as normal, embedded within the page. But now whenever the page is loaded firefox prompts the user with the "What should firefox do with this file?" window or whatever the default action for the PDF file type is. It does not display the content on the page and the iframe is just blank. The iframes still work on chrome so it does not appear to be an issue with my code.

title: Router Login Unresponsive
content: Hi, I am trying to login to my router [asus ac68u] to make some basic changes via 192.168.1.1 and Firefox fails to respond. I've cleared cache and cookies and restarted Firefox but it still fails to load any resemblance of a page. Any suggestions? Cheers

title: Forms and Autofill stopped working
content:
I know that the autofill for credit cards is only available in the US and Canada (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/credit-card-autofill#w_edit-your-saved-credit-cards). I live in the US. The feature was working just fine... until I traveled overseas and used my laptop there and changed time zones to where I was visiting. Now that I'm back in the US, the feature is missing. In the settings, I don't see a "Forms and Autofill" section in the settings. I checked system locale and it's properly set to us-en. All the settings are properly set in about:config. I've tried everything I found by searching online and nothing helped. I even tried creating a separate profile in Firefox to see if the section shows up under setting with no luck.

Any help/suggestions would be greatly appreciated.
creator: sarilouis
